channel.title: Comments on: 27: Artificial Intelligence-assisted peer review

item.title: By: protohedgehog
item.dc:creator: protohedgehog
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://fossilsandshit.com/27-artificial-intelligence-assisted-peer-review/#comment-3221">Dahlia</a>.
Thanks for your comment, Dahlia! You might be interested in the Blockchain for Peer Review project: https://www.blockchainpeerreview.org/2019/06/next-steps-for-the-blockchain-for-peer-review-initiative/ as well as this recent paper on Blockchain technology in Open Science more broadly: https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fbloc.2019.00016/full and then there is also the Blockchain for Science project which contains a lot of active projects in this space, some including peer review I think: https://www.blockchainforscience.com - enjoy! :)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Dahlia.

Thanks for your comment, Dahlia! You might be interested in the Blockchain for Peer Review project: https://www.blockchainpeerreview.org/2019/06/next-steps-for-the-blockchain-for-peer-review-initiative/ as well as this recent paper on Blockchain technology in Open Science more broadly: https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fbloc.2019.00016/full and then there is also the Blockchain for Science project which contains a lot of active projects in this space, some including peer review I think: https://www.blockchainforscience.com – enjoy! ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Dahlia
item.dc:creator: Dahlia
item.description: Very cool series you have here. I found your blog by googling "blockchain peer review" to see if anyone else has had this idea. I was very excited to support a similar blockchain peer review project called Lunyr but unfortunately it seems that that project has been abandoned. My close to finishing a PhD and my limited experience with the peer-review process has been... eye-opening to say the least. Realising reviewers don't get paid and that it takes a long time to get a decision from a journal. It all feels very inefficient. I like the idea of using blockchain and AI to improve that.
item.content:encoded: Very cool series you have here. I found your blog by googling “blockchain peer review” to see if anyone else has had this idea. I was very excited to support a similar blockchain peer review project called Lunyr but unfortunately it seems that that project has been abandoned. My close to finishing a PhD and my limited experience with the peer-review process has been… eye-opening to say the least. Realising reviewers don’t get paid and that it takes a long time to get a decision from a journal. It all feels very inefficient. I like the idea of using blockchain and AI to improve that.
